qas.question: In what century was thought given to monastic reform?
In what year was Cluny Abbey founded?
In what part of France was Cluny Abbey founded?
Along with rigor, what did Cluny have a reputation for?
What reforms were named for the abbey at Cluny?

context: Monastic reform became an important issue during the <a0_0>11th<a0_0/> century, as elites began to worry that monks were not adhering to the rules binding them to a strictly religious life. Cluny Abbey, founded in the <a2_0>Mâcon<a2_0/> region of France in <a1_0>909<a1_0/>, was established as part of the <a4_0>Cluniac Reforms<a4_0/>, a larger movement of monastic reform in response to this fear. Cluny quickly established a reputation for <a3_0>austerity<a3_0/> and rigour. It sought to maintain a high quality of spiritual life by placing itself under the protection of the papacy and by electing its own abbot without interference from laymen, thus maintaining economic and political independence from local lords.
